definition: see 頓挫抑揚|顿挫抑扬[dun4 cuo4 yi4 yang2]
to restrain/to restrict/to keep down/or
abbr. for 揚州|扬州[Yang2 zhou1]/surname Yang
to raise/to hoist/the action of tossing or winnowing/scattering (in the wind)/to flutter/to propagate
to stop/to pause/to arrange/to lay out/to kowtow/to stamp (one's foot)/at once/classifier for meals, beatings, scoldings etc: time, bout, spell, meal
obstructed/to fail/to oppress/to repress/to lower the tone/to bend back/to dampen

sentences.english: In a poem, cadences are arranged in regular sequence.
sentences.chinese: 在一首詩裏，抑揚頓挫是按一定順序配置的。

sentences.english: Tibetan folk song cadence, rhyme Hezhe paste, attractive.
sentences.chinese: 藏族民歌抑揚頓挫，合轍貼韻，悅耳動聽。

sentences.english: Cantabile years of time walking and cadence.
sentences.chinese: 如歌歲月因時間的行走而抑揚頓挫。

sentences.english: Her voice had a soft Welsh lilt to it.
sentences.chinese: 她講話的聲音柔和而抑揚頓挫，有些威爾士口音。

sentences.english: You don't know what I'm saying if I say it in a flat tone.
sentences.chinese: 如果我說話沒有抑揚頓挫，你也不會明白我在說什麼。

sentences.english: Melody refer to the voice of the original cadence, is a spiritual experience.
sentences.chinese: 韻原來是指聲音的抑揚頓挫，是一種心靈的感受。

sentences.english: He read the poems with cadence.
sentences.chinese: 他抑揚頓挫地朗誦詩歌。

sentences.english: His recitation was cadenced and rich in feeling .
sentences.chinese: 他的朗頌抑揚頓挫，富有感情。

sentences.english: Churchill's cadences began to roll out of the short-wave radio .
sentences.chinese: 短波電臺裏開始傳出邱吉爾那抑揚頓挫的聲調。

sentences.english: Liu Wei courtyards and layout, but also voice, though covertly .
sentences.chinese: 而劉煒庭院裏的佈置，卻也抑揚頓挫，暗合音律。

sentences.english: It was the voice of a born orator, rich in possible modulations .
sentences.chinese: 這是一個天生演說家的富於抑揚頓挫的聲音。

definition: verse
tone/note/a tone (on a Chinese syllable)/CL:個|个[ge4]
tone sandhi/modified tone/(music) to change key/modulation
drum beat/rhythm
meaning of word/sense
scholarly flavor/educated appearance
morin khuur (Mongolian bowed stringed instrument)
to keep to the subject
rhyming word ending a line of verse/rhyme
music/rhyme and rhythm/initial, 音[yin1], and final and tone, 韻|韵[yun4], of a Chinese character/phoneme
to tinkle/to jingle/to clank
to do something at one go/to flow smoothly
pun/play on words
lit. slap the table and shout with praise (idiom); fig. wonderful!/amazing!/great!
rhetoric
(of a person) sad beyond words (idiom)/(of music, literature etc) poignant/very sentimental
